text: heard great things about tin tin, so we went for dinner on a Wednesday night. other than the crabs, didn't feel like it was anything special. just another Chinese buffet with a few unique dishes. I felt like they had other items, but no signs or descriptions on how to order from the lady behind the counter. stood there for a minute to see if someone would ask me what I wanted, but that didn't happen either so I decided to skip it. overall experience was not bad, but will not be going back.

I thought this place closed down, but it was only temporary. Needless to say, their food didn't improve with the reopening and it's still way too overpriced ($25 per person). I normally hate buffets anyway and this one was no exception. I used to go here when I was a little kid, but now I'm never gonna go back here ever again.

I used to love this place but it definitely changed. There used to be "All You Can Eat Crab Legs" and they took that off. That sucks. They also had some great garlic crawfish and now it's as if they stopped making it taste good. I usually have their raw oysters and that's the only good thing right now. The raw fish sashimi were dry in the corners and I was soooo disappointed. What happened to the old Tin Tin?

Tremendous selection, absolutely huge. Not much here thats any good at all. I've tried it several times and its been consistantly disappointing. For my tastes, they should cut out about half of the selections and concentrate on making the ones they keep taste better. Hint: when someone gives it 5 stars and talks about their good salads and soups, don't value their opinion about the chinese food ! The food isn't that good, and it costs too much.
Poor service, food is not tasty at all and they don't have verity of chicken. Plus, they have signs at every table which says " don't waste food, take only what you think you will eat." Be aware!
Over priced at $21.99 per person.  Food is gross . . . extremely noisy . . .kids running around like it is a playground.  I will never set foot in this place again.

My son and I went here today and it was pretty good.  However, we were a little disappointed that they didn't have any crab legs.  We actually wanted to go to Joe's Crab Shack but realized when we got there that they had closed down.  :)  Not sure when that happened, but we were sure looking forward to some crab legs.  Oh well...the buffet was good too....just really wanted some crab!!

Coming from the bay area, home to numerous sources of amazing Chinese food (even amazing pan-Asian buffet food, which is almost an oxymoron), I don't expect to be finding much in the way of Chinese food where there are relatively few Chinese. When you're this far from home, the taste buds develop their sea legs, and you start to be able to nod intelligently when people argue about the best ways to cook a pig. But for a taste of home, the heart wants what it wants. Lucky us, a local fan recommended Tin Tin.  We came, we saw, we ate. Some things rocked, like the kid-approved gyoza-like potstickers, black bean spareribs, and the custom-made noodle soups. I loved the Chinese-style fried chicken, reminiscent of many a Chinatown quick eat. Some things were not so great, like the oversteamed dim sum, soggy salad bar, and tired dessert counter. But it was a great spread and value. Kids under 10 eat at such an amazing price, too. I'll be back.

Tin Tin already has 17 reviews and I am usually one for trying to steer from writing a review of the places I have been while also agreeing with the majority of reviews.  Meaning, Tin Tin is already well known and very exposed with good press.  Not to mention I'm not a fan of buffets in general but a Chinese buffet with this much variety *unless you're a veggie head ;) was an exception for me. Plus after my last Chinese review I thought I would chime in.   We have never had to wait on our visits during dinner hours but it is always busy. For the price I think it is well worth it.   Crab Legs, peel and eat Shrimp, Oysters, Mussels. Sounds more like a seafood buffet right?  What? YOU EAT OYSTERS FROM A BUFFET? Yep! And as many as I want!   We probably have sampled it all -oink oink- (not in one visit) and it is all really tasty. Like Bill F- I gotta agree - their fried dumplings or pork filled stickers are always hot and fresh and perfect. And the dipping sauce is great! These are always a first plate for me!  I love string beans from a Chinese restaurant and I am the one you are waiting in line behind while I pick them out one by one of the chaffing dish because I only want the string beans from that certain dish. Please except my apology.   While I did say I was not a fan of buffets in general, for instance, I believe the words Italian and buffet should never be used together *sacrilege* I would also make an exception for a dessert buffet :) and ironically, Tin Tin offers a few desserts on their buffet  BUT I can do with out all of them.  Isn't ironic, don'tcha think? alittle tooooooo ironic...sing it!   Well, I always have room for their ice cream and a fortune cookie.  Bottom line, I have tried a number of Chinese restaurants here in Charlotte but not many Chinese Buffets  so take my five star review for what you will.

When we first moved to Charlotte we were in seventh heaven with this restaurant.  I understand at some point it's come under new management.  They still have good food but it's just not up to the standard or quality of food that they used to have. I'll still eat LUNCH here if in the area. But I will no longer go out of my way to come over here like I used to. The price has also gotten too high for what they're offering, $25 nights and weekends just to include crab legs and a couple of other items . This is my last out of the way trip. Personally I think price is what is killing the once packed restaurant.  Again, still good food but I'd recommend lunch over dinner time. Price and food quality has gone down is only reason I gave it 3 stars. Delicious but just not delicious enough.
Upscale and different Asian buffet. Maybe not for the kids ?? Food was fresh, hot and delicious ! We'll be back !

Though a little more expensive than most Chinese buffets, this place is worth it.  The service is always great, and the selection and quality of food is amazing.  They have traditional Chinese dishes and some tamer fare as well.  Great selection of sushi too.

I wanted to like this place since my husband is trying to find an authentic Asian buffet in Charlotte. I noticed crumbs of food on the floor right away. The carpets and tile floors have a "yuck" factor. My table had a film on it. My husband tried the salmon and said it was okay. I noticed he didn't go back for seconds. I tried several different vegetables dishes. The vegetables were wilted and had a sour taste. I tried some cold meat dishes but wasn't impressed. My poor husband was eating all the subpar food because there are signs posted on the wall at each table that you will be charged for any leftovers on your plate. I also couldn't notice all the food encrusted around the sign.  I ended up eating three bowls of freshly prepared soup (spicy coconut) which was out of this world! The buffet did nothing for me. My husband said he enjoyed the fried chicken but nothing else off the bar.
Too bad this place has closed!  Went last week and there was a chain on the door.

Disgusting , overpriced , don't waste your money and your time . Especially Who introduced the duck was rude, it's a buffet ppl !  and they have one piece policy !! , how is that ? I don't know why ppl go there to waste their money !!

I usted to love this place, but since the re-opening     They have removed the grill and they no longer have wonton soup nor the curry soup. The fried dumplings have a thicker dough than before and the sauce was salty. They provide more options for noodle soups but I missed the wontons.  I don't eat crab legs and dinner was pricey. The ice cream machine was out of order also. They remodeled but they still don't have a baby changing station in the bathroom either. I was very disappointed after being a very loyal Tin Tin lover for the last 7 years.... Oh well

Do not waste your time. Sanitation grade is a 90. Overpriced for the quality. It costs $67 dollars from me and my two young children to eat there. I will not make that mistake again . I will not recommend this restaurant.

I can think of three better buffet place then Tin Tin right off the bat! My parents love Tin Tin for the crab legs so we always end up going here when we're doing a family outing.  Today was Father's Day so we went there since it was my dad's choice. Going there reminded me there's nothing I like about Tin Tin except for their interior design of the place.  Everything at Tin Tin is way too salty! I think this is probably their secret method to get you full quick with all that salt intake.   They have a lot of variety, but nothing that stands out. All I taste is salt! Their sesame chicken taste like they put way too much pineapple juice in there. Butter shrimp is way too salty.   I love lo mein and their lo mein today was just basically noodles and grease. No flavor beyond that whatsoever!  They do not have a good sushi variety either. Fruits are never fresh, ice cream is blah... and way overprice!  **PS, I'm not sterotyping, but I am Asian and I know what good asian food taste like. So my reviews are very honest in terms of quality and taste of food. ** :)

Heard they reopened today and went there. It was a mess. Food was not as good as it used to be and the sea food didn't seem to be fresh. They have less selection now and no longer have the roasted duck. The ice cream machine was out of order - on their first day of opening.... Yet the price was the same as before. It's $50+ for two of us! This is definitely overpriced and you can easily find other places with $10+ and way better selection and quality of food. Very disappointed.

Amazing selection of food and a decent selection of some more traditional Asian dishes for the adventurous American eater. Their sushi is bland and their quality can vary wildly, but their selection and quality of buffet food at good turnaround times makes up for it. Overall my experiences have been positive for the price.

I used to love this place and have even recommended friends to come here but never again. Going there I was aware that they discontinued all you can eat crab legs. As soon as we walked in the door the greeter (possible owner) said "We no longer serve crab legs at the bar". Which made my husband feel like it was racial because he was pretty sure he didn't notice him saying that to all the customers walking in. Anyways we were seated and grabbed our food which was a bad idea. The quality of the food was terrible. The food was dry and not well prepared. The food and even sushi was dry and tasted like it had been out for a long time. We sat there just to see if we saw any workers bringing out new food and we didn't at all. After one plate of barely ate food we got up and left and didn't wait for the non-waiter to bring our ticket. We walked right up to the cashier and paid and explained we have to leave immediately because of the poor quality. We could have gotten better food at our local Chinese takeout spot. I really wish I wasn't writing this review because I truly used to love this place and now I'm extremely disappointed. Never again.

I first went to Tin Tin three years ago and was pleasantly surprised to find a large selection of dishes that you don't find in the usual Americanized Chinese places.  The large number of Asian customers was also encouraging.  Because we live on the other side of town, we have only been a couple of times for lunch.  Unfortunately, our recent experience was not as good.  We went for dinner on Saturday night.  They were very busy, but we only had to wait a few minutes for a table.  The first thing I noticed was that the place was filthy.  The floor was trashed, and there was spilt food and liquids behind a bus cart.  The buffet area was cleaner, but overall I just got a feeling of *ick* about the whole place, like it just needs a good hosing down with a power sprayer.  This probably colored my opinion of the food, but I just felt it was not as good as it had been in the past.  As for service, the dirty plates on our table were not collected in a timely fashion, nor was our water refilled.   If you are looking to try Tin Tin, I strongly suggest going for the cheaper option of lunch, and the possibility of having a cleaner experience when they're not so busy.
Ok place,  food gets cold between lunch and dinner. Overpriced
Wish I could give this place zero. Fish was old food was dry and definitely not sanitary. They also had odor bombs under the seats...nasty.   DO NOT GO!

Wow...HOW DREADFUL.  Just went here for dinner, and since it was packed, didn't bother to look around before deciding to dine.   Besides the copious amount of snow crab legs...the food is greasy, under seasoned and overall fast-food. You can easily tell the fried items are deep fried in oil that hasn't been changed in a long time.  The dim sum is obviously frozen and re-heated.   Why do I know these things?  I used to live in Chinatown in Boston, and if you want good Asian food (Americanized or not) you will not find it here.   BUT: The reason this restaurant has 2 stars from me...only because I know there are gluttons out there who will *adore* shoving their faces with sub-par food, because they can get their money's worth.  I wish I had my $19.99 back.
Overpriced and Nasty. .. Won't go back.. They charge you extra  if you don't eat all the food on your plate... Cheap with the salad dressing. .. They put it on for you....

Let me clarify as too why only 3 stars.  The restaurant itself is very nice in appearance and the variety of food is excellent. The main things that stand out: Customer service, cleanliness and pricing.   Most of the staff doesn't speak English well making it hard to understand them. Every time I needed a refill I had to look for our waitress and wave her down. As far as plates being removed from our table not a problem except one time i wasn't done with my plate and she came by and picked it up without even asking if i was finished or not.   Cleanliness is a big thing for me. My gf likes to say that I'm just a tad bit ocd but I assure you Im not! Lol I simply expect things a certain way.  I definitely dont want to look down and see the food that the people before us were eating. As I walked around the buffet too serve me some food and i would look down and see pieces of food and other small trash around.   The pricing is mainly high because of the "all you can eat crablegs" Now the first time I ever came here it was 19$ and now its 23.50 for one dinner buffet. So for me and my gf our total was 53$. Not exactly the average buffet price other places have. I feel that they should have a lower price for people who opt out of the crab legs.   All in all i will definitely be returning and recommending to others.

Visited for the first time today and for starters the food taste horrible I could get better tasting food at the mall for half the price they try to charge here, it was cold the rice tasted old and overcooked the noodles were dry the sesame chicken tasted old I mean just plain out bad and then when I requested to speak to the manager his excuse was its a buffet the food doesn't have to be hot what the heck is that ?! After that he said I had to pay full price and proceeded to be rude about it like it was my fault I ate one plate and not even all of it yet he still insisted I pay full price I told him I would not pay for food that tasted that bad finally he decided to charge 50% only after I insisted I wouldn't pay he's lucky he even got $4.75 out of me because the service from him was horrible and the food was not any better than his attitude I advise people to STAY AWAY !! Go anywhere but here !!!

When a friend and I walked in at 8:45pm one of the first things we were told was that they close at 9:30pm. That should have been the sign for us to turn around and find another place but we didn't. While the staff was cleaning up all around us we went to the buffet. I did eat my share of sushi (rice so hard it was obvious it had been out for awhile or improperly cooked). Mediocre food at best. When the bill came and it was $54!!! I was stunned. We could have gone to any other restaurant in the area, been treated like welcomed customers and had much better food for less money. Needless to say I will NEVER pass through their doors again.
Been here twice service was cordial menu was fine although more room for variety could be applied.
The crabs where great!  That is the only reason we go.   The sushi looks really good but I am not a fan of sushi.   The food on the buffet is not that great.   Thus I focus on the crab legs only.

I was shocked to see so many negative reviews about Tin Tin recently! I enjoyed my visit there yesterday just as I always do. The key about this buffet is to stick with the "Big Ticket" items such as: the crab legs (so good!), the peel and eat shrimp, the  steamed crawfish, the epic steamed buns, and oh so good peking duck! If you are going to spend $22 for a dinner buffet why would you even touch the almost always generic americanized chinese food?? Get your moneys worth and stick to the "Big Ticket" items! No matter what time you arrive be prepared to wait at least 20 - 30 mintues. The crab legs and other highly sought after items are only offered at the dinner service.
I love the soup here!  I would go here just for that! Beyond the soup, it is definitely one of the better buffet's in Charlotte.  A little on the pricey side but well worth it in my opinion!

Went here for Sunday lunch with my family and I've got to say worst Chinese buffet I've ever been too!!!! Bad food, bad service, even the tea was nasty... Just do yourself a favor and avoid this place...

No more "all you can eat" crab legs at this restaurant!  They really need to take it off their website since it isn't offered anymore!!!!!!!!!!!!   Plus they need to get that low 90 restaurant score up, too!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Gross!  We left & ended up taking our family to The Melting Pot.    45 minute drive each way.  We will NEVER go back, or refer this place!!!  Hmmm...  No wonder their parking lot was SO empty...

I visited them Saturday. Health score is 81. Really, 2 points lower and you're closed. I have enjoyed eating there in the past but I do not want food poisoning so I'll try them again in a few months and if the health score is above 90.

Very disappointing on their first reopening day. The food doesn't seem to be freshed and they have less options than before. Plus, they removed the grill bar and roasted duck. The ice cream maker is out of order as well. What doesn't change there is the price. $25 ppl after tax. I asked the waitress what's going on and she asked me to talk to their boss. Their boss said yes and that's what you gonna pay for. LOL. Never going back to this place again...

The sushi was not fresh.  Very pale, milky colored, like frozen fish.  I saw vacuum sealed packs of salmon behind the counter.  The crab legs were so over cooked, I couldn't even eat them.  The meat just disintegrated when you try to get it out.  The dump some was pretty good.  And very good beef with peppers and onions.  The chow fun was passable.  All in all not worth anywhere near the $21.00 price.

I used to live in Los Angeles, CA and they have alot of delicious Asian restaurant. I have noticed that in North Carolina there are many Chinese/ Asian buffet, but this restaurant was the first one I found with whole lot of quality foods.  The dinner and lunch menu are great and on the weekends they get really busy. Also the service is alot better than the ones that I have experienced in North Carolina.  If you have the hots for Asian food Chinese, Korean, Japanese food I give the two thumbs up for this place!  If you have tasted good Asian food from other states, if you are in North Carolina this is one recommendable place for a bite.
I love this place ,I specially love the soup station the steamed fish and a variety of steam veggies. Why did it closed, someone told me renovation.

I was in the mood for Chinese food and found out quickly this is not the place. I don't have one good thing to say about my visit.  The first booth they sat me in had 4 flies hanging out so I requested to be moved.  The steamed rice, fried rice, chicken and steak on the buffet was cold. Then I tried the soup which had no taste.  I also tried to season myself with salt and pepper to no avail.  Last, I was about to try the Chinese dumpling near the soup when I saw the worker pull them out of a pre-packaged bag.  Goodness!  I paid 25 for two buffets that NOONE could eat and got a upset stomach. :(

People, your positive reviews are killing me. Because clearly Tin Tin is a slop house. Don't bother selling me the mile-long buffet options, because if the most appetizing thing you can find is jello cubes, then you're not selling me anything but a smoke-and-mirrors game.  I'd eaten here before, a few years back. I was getting some car work done at the nearby Griffin Brothers shop (another place to avoid; another review for another time), and had some time to kill while the grease monkeys were pretending to know how to do a 37-point inspection. I'd heard about how awesome Tin Tin's buffet was, so I gave it a whirl.   Bad choice. Pretty sub-standard far, as far as I was concerned. The sesame chicken is drowned in some kind of gooey mystery sauce. Their noodles were criminally salty. As for the sushi...I think I've seen better sushi at a Hardee's. And Hardee's doesn't make sushi. Honestly, I sampled nothing worth a damn here. Yuck. Never again will I step foot in here.  So fast forward about 5 years later. I'm working relatively nearby, and I had a rare opportunity to take a long (read: more than 30 minutes) lunch. One of my colleagues kept saying how much he loves dining at Tin Tin. He told me it had gotten better since I last ate here. But I was jonesing for some Chinese, but didn't feel like going to Wan Fu, since I'd been eating there a lot lately, and I didn't want to get burned out.  I should have trusted my instincts. Tin Tin was WORSE than ever. I was there less than 15 minutes, no joke.  Also, wanna irk the shit out of me, hostess? When I ask to be seated somewhere that doesn't feel as if I'm being exiled to the back of the restaurant for some culinary crime I committed in the past, don't roll your eyes at me. That should have been my cue to get the hell out of there. Stupid me for not listening to my instincts...again.  Tin Tin shouldn't ever be recommended to anyone by anyone, unless you clearly despise that person and wish all kinds of evil upon them. And even then, recommending Tin Tin would be the worst kind of cruel and unusual punishment.  What a dump.
Gross... not impressed. The cost with crab legs is $29.99. The crab legs have no seasoning. The rest of the chinese food was bland. Never again..
Since I can't leave less than one star tin tin gets one. The food here is truly disgusting, cold, slimy, and flavorless. Avoid this place at all costs.

Just joined a great partner at TIN TIN for buffet.  Nice 15 minute trip from downtown Charlotte to the south side.  Great welcome at the door....fast seating....and quickly took the tour of the massive buffet.  Without the tour....I may have missed the dessert bar tucked away near the back corner. First Plate....appetizers, salad and sushi,, tofu.....all good stuff....all very fresh and tasty. Second Plate...seafood, spring rolls, onion rings, shrimp lo mein, butter shrimp, mussels, clams and a chicken wing......oh so good....and not feeling full yet!   Third Plate...Satay chicken, mushrooms and tofu, sweet and sour chicken, peel and eat shrimp, walked past the chicken feet...added some eggrolls...and some delicious red chili paste!!  OK....I have a big appetite! Fourth Plate.....my Veggie plate....with fried rice, green beans, bok choi and wondering...who the heck is gonna drive me back to work???  OK finished it all....and had a nice dumpling to top it off.   Now....back to that dessert bar....OK....plenty of desserts....but I can only eat so much more..... how about a coconut macaroon, a butter cookie complete with almond...and this sesame coated ball filled with gooey sweet stuff.  Alright....ate that...drank my very sweet tea...and called it a day!  Did the waitress just ask me if I needed a NAP????  Thank you partner.....what a treat!!!!!!!!!!!!!!    zzzzzzzzzzzzz!

I've been going to Tin Tin for almost 15 years.  In the beginning it's long-time owners did a really good job of serving some of the better Asian food in the Charlotte area.  Then a few years ago, it was taken over by new owners who were not Asian and the food and the restaurant itself really suffered.  Just a few months ago it was taken over by new owners, who did a much-needed remodel.  The restaurant is now sparkling clean, the servers are very friendly and attentive, and I found the manager to be at the top of his game, with frequent table-touches and ensuring engagement with customers as they arrive and depart.  As for the food:  I've read so many reviews slamming the sushi.  To these people I say, you're eating sushi at a more-or-less Chinese buffet.  Please adjust your expectations accordingly.  The rest of the dishes are definitely house-made, and while not always 100% authentic, they are still very delicious.  Please give Tin Tin another chance; you won't be sorry!

We went on July-10-2015. We were very pleased with the quality of the food.The shell oysters,crab legs,shrimp and sushi are absolutely delicious.The wait staff were friendly and attentive. The price $ 25 bucks per person is fair compared to the amount of choices.Two things that stood out that I liked, was they keep your tea filled and they bring the check after you eat and not during the meal. So me and the better half recommend Tin Tin and suggest you go there hungry and you will be pleased. THE FOOD DUDE.    : )

2 things. 1. dim sum 2. beef chow fun. nuff said.  greenville to charlotte is only 1.5 hour drive.  any time we have family or friends flying for a visit, we make it a priority for them to land at clt for 2 reasons. 1. jamba juice @ the airport, and 2. tin tin's.  it really is middle of nowhere. but it is somewhat close to the south park mall.  the food is really good. everything is really good. i wish they had larger selection of sushi/rolls, but their dim sums and beef chow funs really make up for it.  their service is friendly, it can get crowded so get there early. bathroom is clean (which is a must), and though i've never been to their dinner, my family said it's worth it.  im getting hungry just thinking about it. yum-O

This is one of the best Chinese buffets I have ever eaten at. There may be room for improvement, however the food is very fresh, and the crab legs are quite good. The variety is the largest I have seen when you take into account the three chefs preparing noodles, soups, and meat right before your eyes. When I go to Chinese buffets I usually try the same items such as sesame chicken, and crab ragoons. These items were far and away better than what I have found at other buffets. The buffet is a bit pricey for dinner at $20 for one adult, however you get what you pay for and I will certainly be back.

I live in San Francisco and I think this is the best Asian buffet I've been to. The food here was really good, service was friendly, and so much to choose from. What pleases me most is that my tummy feels fine afterwards. I like the noodle soups they have, egg rolls and crab legs. The tapioca dessert was good and sushi was pretty decent.   I was very impressed when I dined here the 1st time and liked it equally the 2nd and 3rd times. They do a good job handling large groups. Can't wait to go here again when I'm visiting relatives in Charlotte. My whole family thinks it's better than the buffets they frequent in San Jose, CA...I don't dine at buffets a lot but would if more were like Tin Tin!

Was once my favorite restaurant. I didn't mind much they took off the all you eat crab legs. However charging 14$ per lb is overpriced. They use to have a lot of variety hot food, this time they cut down the price but also their varieties. Food was like any Chinese buffet now, bland and cold. I use to drive 1hour 30 for it, now i'll just stay at my local buffet.

NOT THE SAME OWNER....this is a far cry from what it used to be.  The once hottest spot for Chinese food which I've driven 1.5 hrs for is no longer the same. This is now just the same-same run of the mill buffet.  The new owners isn't doing anything wrong if they would changed the name entirely. Keeping the same name sets customers up for major disappointments.

This place use to have a large variety of delicious food, but it seems it has lost its touch. I believe the only thing good here is the soup and the clams. Their sushi bar is basically nonexistent as they never refilled it. Would not recommend overall as there are much better choices in the area for the same cost.

Unfortunately it's not like it use to be. Went here for dinner thinking it would be better than lunch, but the only thing I noticed differently were the raw oysters. The food isn't warm, their bbq pork buns were old and cold, shrimp and squid was tough, most of the food is cold, and a worse sushi selection. They do have delicious taro  buns and their custom soup is good. They don't do takeout by the box anymore, it's per pound. They do have an early bird special. From 4:30-5:30 Mon-Thurs it's $10.50/person. I know I'll be back but would not go for dinner since it's not worth the price. I'd only go for lunch or early birth special since I like the variety

$24.95 is an outrageous price for a buffet. I guess if you like crab legs and are planning to stuff yourself with them until you breathe crab, but for those of us who are going with someone but dont eat seafood, its just way too high. You can go to Tokyo grill and get 2 adults to eat for $22.50, and a small child, there's plenty of seafood there and a hibachi and the food is always good. They just dont have crab legs. So ask yourself how much are crab legs worth to you?

This used to be one of the best Chinese buffet in Charlotte.  But now it is one of the worst.  Terrible, cold, bland and not too many things to eat. Expensive by the way compare with other Chinese buffet. Simple terrible.

not that good. the food is very watered down the hot and sour soup taste like water and there was a smell that can't be described. some of the food was ok but I could not recommend this to anyone. we ordered unsweet tea and when we got it it was bad. it tasted like a dirty sock. sorry if you like Chinese food you will need to go elsewhere. the gas station serves better than this place.

Had heard about this place many times from friends and family and was driving by and thought I would try it. Food is very different but good. Some is cold and some is warm but it's a buffet and whenever you go to a buffet there is always a cold food. Staff was very friendly kept coming to refill my water and take my plate away.  There is a spot where you can make your own soup. You tell the person what kind of noodles you want and what kind of meat and veggies. About 23 dollars for two on the weekend for lunch which isn't bad. They have a Chinese bread there that is to die for. Wasn't sure if we could get it due to them getting ready for dinner but we were able to and my heart melted with this bread. It has strawberry syrup on it and powered sugar. There was also Carmel syrup and chocolate syrup on some with sprinkles. They had the authentic Chinese style foods which you don't find at to many places and it's very interesting to try these foods. Sushi was delicious. Many types to chose from and even had some I have never seen.

I am glad I read the latest reviews. We were going to bring a crowd of 16 hungry adults to celebrate combined birthdays. After learning that Tin Tin no longer serves 'all you can eat' crab legs in the buffet price, no thank you.   If you are the proprietor reading this and understand enough written English....  Sad choice you made. We have witnessed the same decision made by two other restaurants in the Asheville NC area. They have since closed and sold. Their demise was slow and painful. Watching their customer base slowly disappear must have been painful. But that is their dagger in their own back.   Lesson learned for restaurant owners:  Once you have reached a high point on your menu items, never back down or reduce. It is suicide.   Sorry Tin Tin, you were once great, like the Great Wall of China. But, like the Great Wall, it no longer serves a purpose.

I loved TIN TIN. I've been a returning customer for past 12 years, their CRAB LEGS always got me back.   They don't have CRABS no more.  Lowered the buffet price to $13.99 but NO CRABS.  I had to order crab legs separately at $14.99 per pound.  And I ordered 5 lbs of crab legs for the table of 6 people but it was ridiculously small portion, it was about the amount I used to get for myself alone!!!!!! 1/21/17 I saw many customers come in and leave because of the crab legs.  I will not return until they change this.

I am not a big fan of buffets myself but we go to tin tin on a regular basis specifically for the crab legs. The great thing about tin tin is that they realize that people go there just for the crab and they keep two hotel pans full of crab at all times. Most other buffet's that have crab legs really slack on getting them out. Needless to say tin tin is worth the cost. Some of there other items on the buffet are pretty good as well. they always have an array of decent sushi, roasted duck, oysters on the half shell, coctail shrimp, crawfish, mussells as well as all your regular chinese buffet items.

I'm not a big fan of buffets, but this place isn't bad. They have HUGE selection. Also, for those of you who are looking for dim sum in Charlotte area, this may be the best you are going to get. They do have a reasonable number of dim sum items on the buffet line (at least they did on the day I went). Lunch is reasonably priced at less than 10 bucks. I think dinner is a bit pricier though. Be hungry when you go because there's so much to choose from!

This was the worst Chinese place I've ever been to.  The sushi was gross the rice tasted like glue and if you didn't eat all your food it would cost you extra. On top of that it's $20 for an adult and and builders considered 10 and over.  For your sake do not go here

We will not be going back. Their biggest appeal were the crab legs which are NO LONGER on the menu. They are now promoting a budget friendly menu for $14 and the many food choices can only be defined as random. There are so many options that many of the food items (lo mein) are not kept in food heaters but in plates under the lights. There are few Chinese buffet food stables (i.e. general tso chicken, bourbon chicken to name a few). The food that was in the heaters were not hot/fresh. Not worth it and won't be back.

When we first moved to Charlotte almost 12 years ago, we told friends that we have found the best asian buffet. As of 3 years ago, we told friends that it's okay, but now what it used to be. Recently we went to Tin Tin only to find they were closed. I thought "That's a good thing" since in my opinion they were going down hill. I was told the owners just picked up and left. Then I heard they were redoing the place..and sure enough, they reopened. We were anxious to return. In my opinion... they should have stayed closed.  While the soups were ok, a lot of the food like squid was barely cooked. The names of the various dishes were barely written on the glass. The ice cream just dripped out of the machine like ...well use your imagination.   The cookies and other pastries  were just terrible...some under baked and others over baked I think their time has come and gone. I will not return. Charlotte has better to offer.

Could not give you any lower this was the most horrible food that I've ever ate two hours after I left there I am still sick it was disgusting when I complain to the manager there was very little empathy I even go I told him that I was sick it has been a bathroom visit for a long-term care I wouldn't not recommend did anybody it's there

I enjoy the food selection and usually when I visit is about 30 min to 1 hr from the time of opening so I get to try the freshest dishes. Also the cooks continuously come by to replenish the buffet. Staff is very friendly and since I'm a regular they stop by to say hello.

I am from Boston and recently moved to South Carolina.  This is my second taste of Chinese food in The South.  I would definitely say this place is worth trying.  The sushi is fresh and tastes about as good as the kind that you would find in a supermarket (Shaws for those from the Boston area).  The hot & sour soup was very good and the choice of quality entree items was immense.  They have everything from smiley face french fries to frog legs.  I will definitely be making more trips to this place.  Please note that dinner is 2x as much as lunch and starts at 4:30pm.

Tin Tin has become somewhat of a buffet staple in Charlotte. I would definitely recommend reading this review if it's your first time or if you're deciding whether or not it is worth the try. My family and friends have been coming here for years. Let me clarify one essential fragment that completes the full substance that is Tin Tin; this is a "seafood" buffet with a seafood price tag. It is now around $25 per person for dinner. If your focus is on standard Americanized Chinese food (sweet and sour this and sesame that), Tin Tin is not for you. 90% of the locals that come here are on a hunt for lobster, snow crab, oyster, crawfish and clams. They do a good job of refilling the lobster that barely lasts 10 minutes upon arrival. Be prepared to wrestle a seemingly sweet little lady for that lobster. Last time, I stood and waited as FIVE different spoons and clamps dug in the lobster dish for "the good stuff." I, the nice and patient one, was left with sauce and claws. Don't worry, I lucked out on the second batch. I understand the brawl because the lobster is definitely where the gold is! Take notes, this is valuable information. All in all, this is not really a seafood buffet, but you can't opt out of the seafood that is on the buffet bar or for the commotion that fresh lobster brings. Good luck!

It's a bit more expensive than some other competing Chinese buffets, but still a hella lot cheaper than anything I can get in New York, so I have no issues.  There's a decent selection and they at least have some sushi and korean food options.  I also like that they have a station to make your own soup with whatever you want in it.  Other than that, everything else is run-of-the-mill chinese food.  I wish they would turn over the fish dishes a little more often so they wouldn't be so overcooked, but it's still edible.  I could tell that they were itching for me and my family to hurry up so they could turn the table over, but I didn't see anyone waiting and there were plenty of other open tables, so I didn't mind taking my time to get my money's worth.  I'd go back if I had to, but wouldn't necessarily go out of my way.

They don't have much of a selection. I'm disappointed I have to spend so much money on this wack dinner. The only good thing this place has is their crab legs.  I asked the so called sushi chef to make me eel on a bed of rice and him and another person said they don't do that. In my opinion this place is a waste of time and money.

The best time to go is also the worst time to go--during Chinese New Year.  They have special dishes just for the occasion, and it's also when their crab legs are the freshest.  The place is usually PACKED and we've waited more than two hours before being seated.  Insane.  In general, their food, as well as the selection, is pretty good.  I brought a friend here who recently visited China and she was impressed with how authentic the food tasted.

Entire dessert bar was convenience store snacks. Oatmeal pies cut into triangles, powdered donuts from a bag, moon pies. Food was decent. They took crab legs off the menu because it was "in high demand." Which doesn't make sense why they would wanna take it off the menu. Staff was very helpful and nice. Would might return again.

In its hey day Tin Tin was good as far as asian buffets go.  The original owners are back but the food was  only worth two stars.  No grill and limited sushi compared to last year when we were here last.  Brought our kids and their spouses tonight  but now wish we would have chosen a steak house.  For the cost we could have all eaten better food elsewhere.  I will give them 5 stars for service because we had a fabulous waitress.  She was the only good thing at Tin Tin tonight.  Not coming back to Tin Tin unless we hear that things drastically change.
Food was good but very expensive for buffet and drink. It was 30.00. I didn't even have the crab legs.

WHAT ARE YOU DOING!!!!  Once my favorite place to visit.  Even went by there weekly (and I live 30 minutes away) when you were closed for renovations.  I have been a loyal patron since the day you opened your doors and you did a fantastic job for years.  I travel weekly and couldn't even find anyone elsewhere that compared to Tin Tin.  Since you reopened your doors you have done nothing but get worse and worse.  From cold food on the buffet to removing crab legs from the buffet.  What are you thinking?  I kept coming back over the years despite the large price increases and the rude signs threatening additional charges for plates with food left on them.  I kept coming back because of the crab legs and hot food on the buffet.  Now it's no crab legs and the food is cold.  Why would anyone want to pay for that??  It doesn't matter that you reduced the cost.  I don't want to eat that crap and neither does anyone else.  That's why you went from people waiting for an hour for a table to no one at your restaurant anymore.  CHANGE BACK NOW or give up to the inevitable and close your doors.

If you love Chinese food and buffets then this is the place for you. It can get pricey but you definitely get a lot of bang for you buck!   And your not limited to Chinese, they have Sushi, as well and some American favorites for the kids. This is the place that I love going to time and time again. My thing is loading up on Crab legs and going to town.  Definitely a place everyone should experience.

The price to eat here is completely worth it if you know how to eat.  Do not dine here and not eat everything.  Fresh crab legs, oysters, and shrimp make the price completely worth it.  I gorge on seafood here.  Their buffet options are plentiful as well.  It's only considered pricey if you don't know how to make the most out of every buck.

Don't normally feel like "gee I wish we hadn't ate there" but that is just how we left after dinner this past Wednesday. The food all looked like it was left there since lunch. The soup was so crusty and dark I mentioned to a waitress that happened by and she mentioned it to the owner. I simply asked if she would eat that soup there on buffet . The owner came and had a new bin of soup brought out. The crab legs were good but all watery and stuck to the shells- which is an indication they are not fresh. The salad bar area did not have the usual Asian salad only some dark (almost black) sea weed salad. The Fruit was all dried out - I had to roll the oranges in the water to soften them up and the ice cream machine was "out of Order" ... So I don't think for 24.99 it was a good experience for me. The food was sub par for the price - the waitress was clearly uninterested in us. I did manage to find one gal who continued to check on us after she helped with the soup debacle... She continued to make sure we were okay so when it came time for the tip - she got it - though she was not the waitress at our table -  take always ...? Don't eat there mid week - the food is old and doesn't get refreshed with new food... Save your money and go to Wan Fu !

Tintin has finally opened again. The depression is over! Haha. Just kidding..... But everyone is glad to see it open and running again. Prices are the same. Food is the same... With some new additions.... Soup is still my favorite. I tried the new curry broth... It was good and a little spicy.... Seeing old faces here. Wait staff, host... Etc. that's a good sign. Crab legs are only at dinner time.

I have never changed my review as drastically as I am doing this time. I was seriously burned by the serving utensils at their buffet.  three fingers were second degree blistered because the utensil was left in the steam on the chafing dish. when I went to complain to the management he could care less treated me with  indignity and disrespect.  He angered me more than getting burned did. When I complained and got no response from the management the employees at the restaurant came to my aid but the manager at the restaurant told me if I wanted to get a lawyer and sue to go ahead  he could get one too and didn't care. I would never ever go back to that restaurant because of the way that it's being run and buy who's running it. As It turns out the manager or maybe he was the assistant manager was the brother or brother in law of the owner. I have know Ken the owner for years and he is a fine gentleman but the manager I had to deal with should be replaced by someone who can help, not hurt the business  My hope is that enough people out there read this review and go somewhere else. There are too many other Chinese buffets to go to a place that treats you this way

I have a love hate relationship with Tin Tin. Every time I come home to visit my parents in Charlotte, they wanna come here. My dad loves his buffets so I always get suckered into it. It always seem like a good idea at the time but I always leave wishing I never came!  For those of you that have been to Minado(the king of all seafood buffets) this is a cheap imitation.  Sure they have oysters and snow crab legs and clams and sushi, butthe quality is not the same. The oysters I wouldnt touch with a ten foot pole because it looks slimy and yucky. The sushi/sashimi all look like it was defrosted and I can't get myself to eat thawed out raw fish. I also skip all the hot food because its all generic american-chinese sesame chicken kinda food. The only saving graces are the crab legs which are decent and fresh, simply boiled. The pecking duck which they carve for you on the spit and put on a white bun with cucumber, housing and scallions. And the noodle soups they make to order. (I like the spicy broth)  People seem to love this place tho because there is usually a wait in weekends. You also have to be hyperagressive with getting the crab legs. But I'm not down with elbowing my way to the steam table to get my grub on.

You can't beat all you can eat crab legs! The buffet is HUGE and the food is amazing! Sushi, american, Chinese, Japanese, and so much more. I wouldn't come unless I was going to eat crab legs since the buffet is over $20. We come here for birthdays, graduations, and holiday parties! Absolutely incredible!

I'm not sure how much longer Tin Tin's will be open. Let me start with my past experiences here.  Approx 2006- This Asian buffet restaurant was amazing. I would literally drive from Columbia SC (an hour away) to feast at this incredible restaurant. They had an amazing made to order soup bar. Delicious soup! I would sometimes go for a second bowl. Short ribs and grilled teriyaki appetizers. Fresh sushi made in front of you and made to order if you wished. Nice salad bar and Bubble Tea tapioca to enjoy. The hot bar selections were abundant. Everything from the familiar Generals Tso's  chicken to the more exotic Chicken Feet. So many choices. When we went the restaurant always was filled with about 50% Asian customers. It wasn't only "Americanized" Asian food but also authentic Asian cuisine. Service was fast, food was fresh and abundant. Fast forward to last year, 2017. We went and there were noticeable changes. Food was subpar. Still had the great soup and sushi. Service was lacking. I read others reviews that they stopped the AYCE Crab legs. I was never into them so this didn't affect me.  Last night...We drive down Park Road. Lights are on but only four cars in the lot. It was 6:30. Maybe to early for Charlottians to eat dinner and it was a Tuesday. We walk in and the bar section is completely dark. No hot bar, no sushi and NO SOUP!!!  The hostess politely informed us they no longer offers the buffet during dinner hours of the week. We were saddened. We were aching for the soup.  At this point I don't see it lasting much longer. They aren't offering the buffet because people stopped eating it. I will always have fond memories of Tin Tin's of the past though.

My husband and I came here after a long day at Carowinds because we were starving and I wanted crab legs. I would never pay $25 for an Asian buffet, but for crab legs?  Absolutely! I couldn't believe the quality of the crab legs--they were fresh, large, moist, and warm.  I have never had such delicious crab legs on a buffet before.  We definitely got our money's worth on the crab legs alone.  We must have eaten about 15 clusters between the two of us!    After we were all crabbed out, we decided to try a plate of the other buffet items;  everything was average and exactly what you would expect from an asian buffet that is focused on feeding the masses. So, ignore the rest of the buffet items, go for the crab legs and eat your weight in them. They are such a great deal.

I see all the negative reviews , I would not pay any attention to those... You will miss out on an amazing buffet... My family and I just left and it was as amazing as it was before... We came from Orlando to South Carolina and had to visit Tin Tin.. Do yourself a favor and ignore the negative reviews... Good service and pleasant managers!!!!

Everytime I drive past Charlotte, NC, I'm tempted to stop here.  MAIN REASON:  The All You Can Eat is sooo worth it b/c the snow crab legs are medium-sized, fresh and almost never empty!  It's worth the detour and the price.  Wish there was a Tin Tin in Atlanta.

Way too expensive for what it is! They charge like $20 per person for the dinner buffet. I know they charge the high amount since they have crab legs but for people like me who don't eat crab legs- it's a total waste. That's got to be the only thing that keeps them busy... Not impressed.  PS- My husband got several crab legs and the majority of them barely had any meat!! It was a waste of money & waste of time!

I have been a customer of Tin Tin since it was built way way many many years ago.  And throughout the years, it's been pretty consistently good.  I always crave the soup noodles but I don't know if it's worth it anymore..  Last week, I was home for spring break and of course we went to Tin Tin to satisfy my noodle craving.  We got there, and we waited for about 20 minutes until we were seated - not a bad wait for 7pm on a Saturday night.    In the past, my parents always complained how the waitresses couldn't speak english and didn't smile or ask about how we were doing.  This time around, however, our waitress was very friendly and fluent in english - both pleasant surprises.    So the night was off to a great start.  But then! (dun dun dun!) I found a piece of plastic in the beef/noodle stirfry. We told the waitress and asked to see the manager.  The waitress apologized many times but the manager failed to show up for 10 minutes.  Now, usually if something like this happens, then my expecation is that the manager comes over as soon as he or she is free, apologizes, and then usually offers some sort of compensation.  So I was just sitting there for what felt like forever (although it was only 10 minutes), watching him stand at the podium idly, checking the seating list at times and calling people over.  I think that is a job that the hostess can do herself while you leave for two minutes.  Furthermore, when he came, he looked at the piece of plastic and apologized in a "sorry not sorry" tone without any offer of a discount for our meal.  Knowing that this would be my last visit, I ordered one last bowl of noodles.  Goodbye yummy noodles forever..   For the amount you pay for this food, go somewhere fancy downtown.  For being part of the SERVICE industry, they (the managers, not the waitress I had) suck at service.    So we paid, we left, and we won't ever be going back.  #saltycustomer
There were people with yellow Tyvex suits cleaning it out. Renovation is an understatement. I would have to say this place is closed up or stripping walls bare for entire rework.

We went for lunch today and it was quite good. Lots more of a selection than I am used to, and much more authentic-looking than a typical Chinese buffet; they had everything from duck and fresh noodles to your typical american fare like french fries.  Lunch was $8.95 plus $1.45 for a drink, so I think it's a good value. Dinner was, I think, about $16 on weekdays, and a dollar or two more on weekends/holidays.  I would've rated it 5 stars, but some of the food seemed like it was out a little too long (maybe because it's a Wednesday and I went around 2pm when lunch stops at 3). Some of the food just didn't taste right because it had kind of dried out sitting on the buffet.  All-in-all, highly recommended if you are looking for a nice buffet.

Finally, a buffet worth a darn in Charlotte! Having recently moved from Las Vegas, we know a thing or two about buffets, and Charlotte is certainly lacking in this department. However, Tin Tin is a pretty good one, albeit a little pricey (cost us $32 with tip and 2 soft drinks for LUNCH). But, they did have a fresh food station, where they cook up some tasty meats, soups and sushi. They had your standards like sesame chicken, lo mein, etc.   They obviously cater to the Asian crowd as they had many seafood items that you normally wouldn't see (crawfish, whole fish with scales, etc.). And there were plenty of Asian customers in there, which usually is a GOOD thing as they normally wouldn't patronize a sub-par place.  And the food indeed was tasty, decent quality and a nice variety.  I imagine that the dinner for 2 would be in the $50 range, which again, especially for Charlotte, is pretty pricey. But I think lunch certainly is worth it. Just bring your appetite and you'll get your money's worth.

So you know by the amount of stars that I already don't like this place.  I will do my best to be kind and ignore the not-so-important points like this place looks like a strip club at night.  It was in fact, on my own accord that I walked in here - so I have no one to blame but myself.  But in all fairness I'd like to throw a quick middle finger to those yelpers to added to the average 4 stars this place has received.  That is false advertising people!  You are supposed to help a sister out, not walk her into the lions den.    So I walked into Tin-Tin, all glitz and glamour, it looked pretty good!  Not to mention there were a lot of butts in the seats - so how bad could this place really be?!  I was hungry and really looking for a solid Chinese buffet that I could gorge myself on.  We sat down and the waitress took our drink order.  We then walked over to the buffet, looked around and made our selections.  I started with a few small portions so I could try everything.  The pork dumpling was so foul that I literally spit it out into a napkin!  I was embarrassed, but the thought of swallowing it was more horrifying.  The green beans were SOAKED in a thick garlic sauce, the sesame chicken was chewy - and not in a good way... not to mention the sauce looked like gold jello.  The lomein was tasteless.  The only thing I did like was the sesame bean ball -- which is hard to mess up!   After our first plate we were so unimpressed that we decided to do fruit/dessert and get on our way.  The fruit was mostly hard and I'm fairly certain their frozen yogurt is just flavored ice.  The waitress comes over and hands us our bill.  $23 dollars a person?!  WHAT!?  Not only was this meal disgusting, robbing me of any satisfaction.... now it's robbing my wallet too!    It was at this point we looked up and realized everyone was hoarding crab legs and oysters.  OH.  Wish someone would have let us know that the ONLY reason people came here was for the seafood.... I just wanted a good old fashion Chinese buffet to get full on... is that too much to ask?  As a last ditch effort I tried a crab leg and a clam.  The clam tasted like they marinated it in wet cat food and the crab was nothing to write  home about.  I do NOT recommend this place to anyone, friend or foe.

My critique begins as all critiques begin, with doubt.  I frequented Tin Tin recently for dinner with a good friend of mine and was thoroughly disappointed in the food, the restaurant, and the dining experience as a whole. Chinese buffet restaurants tend to run in a middle sort of groove. No great highs, no crippling lows. The only time they are really exceptional is the first six mos to a year they are open. Soon after that things go downhill, some faster than others. This particular restaurant was fairly nice visually, but once I put my glasses on I could see the filthy floors and walls, and greasy tables. Describing the food on the buffet is like dancing to no music. Most of the items I sampled on the buffet were either underseasoned, flavorless, or not fresh. The sesame chicken for example, looked like it had been in those trays under heat lamps all day. Most of the vegetable offerings were very oily and greasy. The sushi bar was slightly better, but most of the sushi I sampled was a little too fishy and the seaweed salad was like mush.  The best thing I had in the buffet was the Thai style chicken, but it wasnt impressive by any means. The highlight of the night was watching my date who only had one plate of sushi vomit in the parking lot shortly after we got to the car. Tin Tin was a serious disappointment.  I might go back for a second attempt, probably wont.

Some friends and I thought it would be a good idea to head here for dinner.  Not so much....  I typically don't like buffets in general but have done them.  This was really not that great.  Pleasant staff but food was so-so.  Should I decide to ever go to a Chinese Buffet in the future, it won't be this place.
one of the best chinese buffet ever.  not a humongous selection, but a variety of quality food. sushi, noodle soups, tropical fruits, crab legs, etc.  a must go to place when we are in town.

Once was something to rave about.. those times are long gone. Food is below average, I honestly feel like I'm taking my chances taking a bite into something.  Not as good as it once was. Had a great run but I'm pretty sure new ownerships are having a tough time to get their shit together on this place. Return to what it once was and people will come back. For the mean time ... stay away.

this place is awesome. they have all kinds of stuff that is actually good: ham hocks, escargot, steamed fish, pho, and steamed buns. the sushi isn't crazy good, but is okay especially for a buffet. the crab legs and oysters are very fresh too. the wait is pretty long, but always worth it. i mean it's a buffet, so it's okay to go in extra hungry!
For this to be a buffet,  not much of variety.  Too expensive,  and the food is terrible.  I will never eat here again.

This popular restaurant is always crowded and offers a huge array of everything - hard to find Asian favorites (like chicken feet and hog ears), savory soups made to order, expansive sushi bar and all the other usuals.   HOWEVER after about five visits, I've had it with the rude service and the low sanitation scores (typically in the high 80s.) Salmonella must not be a real concern for its regular customers, nor the owners. That's a shame because I would really like eat there, but no worries TinTin, your parking lot will still be full, regardless of my bad review and all the others.

We visit tintin every Monday lunch.  It's a good place to have all combined asian food buffet restaurant.  They have alcohol, such as wine and beers.  They also have Japanese sushi rolls and nigiri.  Their regular food includes Chinese lo mei, stir vegetables and white rice and noodles; dim sum and red beam bum.  They don't have a lot chicken, but sea food and pork are all there.  I love their fried jumbo shrimp, curry noodles and spicy sour soup.

I always passed by Tin Tin and it is always packed. So I finally made it in and expecting great food. I was disappointed. For the price they charged for buffet the food should have been so much better. The food did not stand out. They had a lot of station but nothing was worth raving about. The food was bland and the seafood was sucky. I will not go back and I advise if you never been there don't waste your time.

I'd first like to start off by saying, me giving this restaurant a 2 star rating is being generous. It would be an understatement to say that the food here is bad. To be thorough in my evaluation of this place, I tried just about everything on the menu, all coming to one conclusion. TERRIBLE. I don't want to sound as if I have an underlying  issue with this place, I'm just a disappointed customer. I would not recommend at all.

I love this place.   ;) so most that work here don't speak English well so they don't say much.  Not a bad thing, it is what it is.  The wide variety of food on the Buffet explains perfectly who is eating here.  Chicken feet.  Duck.  Crawfish. Butter shrimp.  Crab legs.  (The real reason to go) no crab at lunch only dinner.  Fri sat sun dinner is almost 25$ per person.  The signs all over the restaurant repeatedly say don't waste food so we can keep prices low.   Price used to be under 20$ per person couple years ago.  Waste and food costs are so high.  But still all you can eat crab legs.   No one offers that any more.  Sunday brunch buffets are pushing 40$ per person so I think the price here is still good!!! Don't expect 5 stars or excellence in dining.  It's a buffet.   But do leave a tip and enjoy a very good one at that!!!!

Lunch, sure it's a pretty good steal. Dinner? No way. Still doesn't make me feel like buffets are worth it. This one is located in South Charlotte, right off of 485. It's a little, lets say, worn. It's been here for quite a while and well, if you go into the bathrooms you are sure to see some interesting graffiti.   While on the outside, they try to make it look grand and majestic, it just isn't what they want it to be. Actually, to be honest I'm amazed that they're still standing and in business. I guess buffets never go out of style, but if you've read my reviews on buffets you know I'm not as fond.  So, what's Tin Tin's assortment of food? You know the usual American Chinese food mixed in with some Japanese "sushi" and some soups/noodles. This is only for lunch. I hear that during dinner there is a wider assortment and a little more of the pricier items, hence the price difference.   The food was well, food. Nothing exciting. Nothing amazing. And somewhere where I would never go if not for company wanting to go and eat. Maybe it's great for big parties, but when it comes to Chinese food, I just get picky. I probably won't come back here because (1) it's a buffet, (2) I've had better buffets, and (3) rather spend my money elsewhere.

Soooooooo disappointed.... Used to be one of my favorites but now just an overpriced bland buffet.   Your best bet is to go with the soups... Saving grace??? Is the large selection of ok tasting belly filler

If anyone is wanting a snow crab buffet to enjoy, do not come during lunch hours. Arrive only during dinner hours. They only serve it then. Other than that. The food wasn't that great. Poor selection of foods to choose. I've been to better Chinese buffets that has a whole variety of foods to choose from.

I have been going to this place for 10 years, and I see the price increased from $12.95 to $23.95 now at weekend!  This place is great for unlimited crablegs and other seafood, but don't expect much out of the service. I mean let me rephrase.. there's no service at all!!!!  All the service barely speak English, which is not a problem. The thing is they all looked like they are constipated for days. No smile on the face whatsoever....  so if you can ignore the service, the food is great. also, make sure you starve yourself for half a day before you go to make the money worth.

This had been the best in town for many years. I moved away and came back about 3 years ago and couldn't wait to go back. It's been about 3 years till I tried it again today because how disappointed I was.  I had heard that the original owners were back and they are. It IS ONCE AGAIN the best around. I gave it 4 stars because a lot of the food was a little cold at 12:30. They were not very busy today at lunch. But the selection is great along with the service. Lots of sushi. Roasted lamb. Missed the sho mi. The Butter shrimp is a litter different. But it's once again some of the best buffet food anywhere. Can't wait to go back. So if you were like me very disappointed on your last visit Please try one more time. You will surprised at the change and be very happy you did.
They have reopened!!!!! They did some slight freshening up on the decor. They still have the same offerings but they are doing them in smaller batches do that they will be fresher and better quality

Would not star it at all but don't think i can review without something. Have not been in a while and we wanted Chinese buffet so we went for dinner last nite. Everything was absolutely horrible. Butter shrimp, Mongolian beef, sweet and sour chicken, pork egg roll, champagne chicken. The only thing that was any good was the crinkle cut fries and the white rice. The three if us will never return.

I used to come here years ago, right after it opened up. I used to bring family and friends to a (at that time) best Chinese buffet around. But, like most of these places, as time went by and food quality declined, so did my visits. I received one of their advertising flyers that they went through remodeling, and to visit them after all the changes. So I did. Honestly I see no changes. Perhaps few different food items, but overall it's the same old place. Not trying to say anything bad about the place, just little disappointed that the standards didn't go back where they used to be when they opened. Still a decent lunch.
Food was cold, really no options on the food. Really disappointed for eatting here for the first time. SMH
Price gouging 25 for a Chinese buffet that was less then average. Capitalism meets gecko

My family use to come here DAILY for years! This says a lot since we lived like 35 minuets away, but we use to love coming here for the unlimited crab legs and fresh, good food! It's been a while since we were last here because of the drive but we decided to revisit this place again. We were kinda shook when we arrived because it wasn't crowded as it use to be, and it was a Sunday. This place use to be PACKED like the wait would be 45 minutes on the weekends! But it was kinda slow, also they took away the unlimited crab legs! Whatttt!! Their food also declined A LOT, the sushi was a bit dry, fish wasn't cooked all the way and some of the food looked as if it was sitting out there for days. It was disappointing since my family used to love this place. The only bright side was that they added steam buns! Hopefully they get their game up again, because at this rate the food is just going downhill.

The atmosphere has changed greatly. I drove 1 hour to enjoy unlimited crab legs and was very disappointed to find out they don't have them on the bar anymore. The crab legs were the only reason I traveled this far to eat Asian food. Never again! The food is mediocre, limited variety of sushi, the soup doesn't even taste the same. Goodbye Tin Tin! I will find another restaurant to patronize.

I ate here at lunch today.  Just like most buffets, the seating, beverage service, and checkout were very efficient and the staff were pretty polite.  I though this place had a wonderful variety of food, possibly more variation than I've ever seen in the past at a buffet.  They had a few of the traditional dishes such as beef and peppers, chicken and broccoli, egg/spring rolls, etc, and about 6-7 different kinds of fish.  The had a separate sushi bar which a large variety of rolls amount other items which I didn't even recognize --though my sushi knowledge is quite limited.  They had a ton of over foods which were good for kids, such as fries, Smiley Faces, chicken nuggets, etc.  They also had a nice array of soups and a pretty decent dessert spread, too.  The place itself felt a but grungy, and the bathroom smelt like, well, a bathroom --just one which hadn't been cleaned in a while.  The overall experience was good and I though the food was pretty tasty.  I'll certainly make a lunch stop here again --not so sure about evening, though.

This place is alright. Their sushi is my favorite, as I haven't been to any other buffet in town that has comparable stuff. The food isn't that amazing though, I guess I've just gotten tired of the same thing over and over since I've gone. I wish they would add some new items on now that they've been in business for such a long time. The one thing I did not like was the fact that all the employees came out and started eating within 5 minutes of me being there, I guess I'll have to try and go earlier next time?

Been here couple times. The food sometimes plain and cold. Basically its all about luck if you go on the right day or not; but it acceptable. The only reason i come here are for seafoods. I can understand it a little pricey. But i can't accept it when the services are terrible. * I dont feel comfortable while eat and the waitress staring down at me, talk to each other, laughed... And back to staring. *Whenever i go with my bf's mom, they got attitude and rolled eyes serving her but not me.  shes mexican and im asian. So tell me they're not racist. They shouldn't be, because they dont even speak English, hiding in the corner talking to each other their language the whole time. * Asked my sister for refill, she responded "yes please", and the waitress just walked away until 10 minutes later came back with another one ask again... So.. Wtf?  Especially Those waitresses on the right of the restaurant where the oysters side are mostly for 4 people, i wouldnt sit there any minute! Im telling you they got attitude more than others.  Im an easy customers just want to eat in peace and go home.  But everytime i come same thing happen, is it because an asian dating a mexican?? Thats insulting!!

You got one star because it wouldn't let me give you anything less it was the worst Food experience I have ever seen ever had it looks good it smells good it tastes like garbage this is my opinion in my opinion only fortunately I don't live in this area cuz if I did that would be going there anyway so I'm going to go over there now anyway so before you go check all the all the reviews in here thank you

Up front,  we decided to give them a try again.  Received a buy one get one free coupon,  to learn that the coupon actually  good for $10 off, but the buffet cost was $13.99....totally misleading,  misrepresenting coupon.  As for the food: okay, at best.  Had the restaurant not been ice cold, the food may have been better.   The minute you set it on the granite table top,  all heat goes away and you have cold food.   Provided feedback to the management and all they had to offer was "sorry ".  Terrible customer service. Unacceptable response. Probably won't go back.

Hit up Tin Tin yesterday for lunch while working in the area. It wasn't bad at all....for a buffet. I'm usually not a big buffet fan, just for fresh food reasons, but everything here was pretty good. They have a hot grill station cooking all the time, as well as a sushi station. I did not try the sushi (way too scared to eat buffet sushi), but many others were eating it.  The big draw here seemed to be crayfish, which I would not expect at a Chinese buffet. But most people had a big bowl for the shells, and were going at those things like they were about to become extinct. The egg rolls were not that great, just nasty cabbage, nothing else. The sesame chicken was a little too sweet for my taste. But hey, its a buffet, I was not expecting gourmet food. Would love to come back and try more, as there was a lot to choose from.

This place used to be awesome.  After they closed and reopened, the food has never been the same. They have half the selection at approximately  $5 more per plate than other buffets ($17 more if you want crab legs).  I keep going back hoping the food will get better and I am consistently disappointed. I am going at the prime times and the food seems like it's a day old. The food that is actually fresh is bland. If you spring for the crab legs, be prepared to fight the line to actually get some.  Other times there are no plates to get the food. The service is not good either. I'm not judging on whether the staff actually understands English, but whether you can actually get a drink when you order it without asking for it a second time.  I just spent 2 hour there (45 minutes for the check) and was only able to get a couple refills. I don't know what has changed, but it seems like they are short staffed and trying to squeeze every cent out of the restaurant at the cost of the food quality and service. I go in hoping for the old times and leave feeling like I've been had.

I'd put 0 stars out of 5 if it was an option.  Decent variety but awful flavor. I think the worst part of it all was the $25 per person price tag and being charged $2 for a glass of tap water. Don't be fooled by the neon lights and full parking lot. Just keep driving.

Tin TIn is one of the best buffets I've ever been to, and it's some of the most exciting, authentic, and delicious Chinese food I've ever had. The place makes me wish I had two stomachs, as I'm never able to eat as much as I'd like.  The steamed peach buns are amazing, and the fresh sushi bar is excellent. There's all kinds of weird meats and seafood for the adventurous carnivores, and there's lots of veggie options including both the Chinese buffet standards (lo mein, spring rolls, etc.) and exotic oddities.   The Thai stuffed tofu is excellent, and I've heard from those who partake that the crab legs are very fresh and yummy. There are always little bowls on the tables for collecting the cast off shells of the crabs. I get a little freaked out by the scene of crab-leg eating, but I try not to let that distract me from the Chinese foodfest.  It's a little off the beaten path, but it's worth the trip. I recommend going on a weekday, as the weekends can get a little chaotic (and, it's also a little cheaper during the week).

I came to visit this place after not living in the area for nearly 3 years. At first, the reviews scared me. I used to love this place and was wondering what happened. But I took a chance and I'm glad I did. Me and my entire family loved it. Yes it's $24.95 but there's so much seafood on the bar, what do you expect? Where else can you get unlimited crab legs, shrimp, mussels, crawfish and traditional Chinese cuisine for that price? Yes there are cheaper Chinese buffets but they don't have near as much variety. So yeah if you're cheap, don't come. Eat fast food. We enjoyed the food and the service was great. I hope this restaurant stays around and continues to have success.

I gave this place four stars because, I love buffets that has good seafood, particularly, blue crabs! Recently, they did not have them....  My coworker, last year had mentioned I could get blue crabs at a Chinese buffet.  Being leary, we met up and the rest is history!  Location - a bit of a drive, towards South of Charlotte, between CVS and some Baby store.  Place - it was huge! But was I surprised? Nah, I have seen huge Chinese buffet restaurants before. But the inside, they had a lot of tables and chairs to accomodate the customers.  There are aisles and different selections of food that were actually good.  I have been to some buffets and most of the time, it was a turn off. But here, it is definitely worth your trip.  Selections -  There a handful of desserts (I love their egg-tarts!), dim-sum like dishes (I liked the shrimp dumplings and sticky rice), Vietnamese dishes and buns, in the middle of the restaurant, lies their  cold dishes, such as seafood of oysters, sushi, freshly cut fruits, sometimes they have Asian exotic fruits (one time, I had dragonfruits)!  On the other side of the middle island, lies their delicious green onion pancake, short rib beef (I feel like it was Vietnamese style) that I was yummy.But boy, people really come here for the snow crab legs!  Price - It was pricey, but with good food, and unlimited crabs I could eat, I did not mind the price. I think for my husband and I, at 5pm, it came up to be $60 (including tip).

One of the biggest, cleanest Chinese buffet restaurants I've been to. There are crab legs which I like to pile up on first when I go for dinner. Also other unique things such as snail, frog legs, duck, sushi, and other American foods as well like chicken nuggets and fries. There is much more than what I've listed here though. Definitely worth the money if you have a bottomless pit for a stomach.

My girlfriend and I just moved to the area and we thought this place looked great from the outside with all of the lights and color. Then we went inside and the place was gross. Dirty floors and the Windows over the food had hand prints all over them. The food was not great and when we went to pay our bill for the buffet we were shocked when our total was $30 each...don't go here.

Once again, they're closed for renovation. The sign on the door says, "Closed as of September 1, will open soon."  Hopefully, they'll bring back crab legs. That's the only reason why anybody wants to eat there.

I have been eating here for over ten years, but the last couple of times the food was not as good. Last week we ate there and everything was barely warm, fried shrimp was cold. I told the waiter and the Manager, nothing but sorry. To top it off they charged my card twice. I called the Manager and he said give it a few days.well, still on card so having to dispute it. My last visit to what used to be my favorite.
Pork chops, curry soup, are tasty   Lo Mai Gai is good but has no lap cheung  Dofu pi juan is vegetarian

Don't go here unless you want to eat leftover food from customers. I heard that they make their employees take crabs from people finished plate and reuse to cook crab asparagus soup. That's just gross! If you guys don't make enough money then just shut it down. Reusing food that other people have touched is just not right. This buffet was good 5+ years ago.

Went for lunch and had really high hopes. I love a good buffet. A good variety of foods but the flavor was lacking in every single one...even the cups of ice cream.
